title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours, calculate sleep debt based on a target sleep schedule, and visualize their sleep patterns. Leveraging modern web technologies, this application offers a simple and effective way to improve sleep habits and understand sleep deficiencies.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern dashboard interface. Leveraging the power of Next.js, this repository provides a foundation for creating interactive and visually appealing dashboards with reusable components and a focus on performance. This project explores best practices in front-end development and serves as a learning resource or a starting point for building custom dashboard applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a personal project utilizing TypeScript and JavaScript to build [insert project's main function or type, e.g., a dynamic web application, a data analysis tool, etc.]. Focusing on [mention key aspects, e.g., clean architecture, performance optimization, user experience], this repository explores best practices in modern web development and aims to demonstrate practical application of the chosen technologies.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to facilitate simple and efficient online voting. This project allows users to create polls with various options and enables voters to easily submit their choices, providing a streamlined approach to decision-making and consensus building within a user-friendly interface.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built using JavaScript, Python (likely for backend or data processing), HTML, and CSS, designed as a project to visualize and interact with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. It aims to provide a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, sensor data, and potentially controlling robot actions, serving as a practical application within the broader Robofleet ecosystem.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project showcasing a collaborative idea-sharing platform built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a functional implementation of an interactive idea board, enabling users to contribute, organize, and explore innovative concepts. It serves as a practical example for learning about modern web development practices and building dynamic user interfaces with a focus on project organization.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML project that delivers a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. This repository houses the code for creating a dynamic calendar where events can be easily displayed and managed, offering a user-friendly experience for scheduling and viewing important dates.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase, designed for tracking IoT assets. Leveraging real-time data and a clean, responsive UI, the project provides a comprehensive solution for monitoring and managing asset location and status, demonstrating best practices in modern web development using a serverless backend and type-safe frontend.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with Material UI (MUI). It serves as a comprehensive project management and collaboration tool, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and management. Key features include task management, team collaboration, and project progress tracking, all implemented with a modern and responsive user interface. This project showcases best practices for building scalable and maintainable web applications with a focus on type safety and performance.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [Insert brief description based on README - e.g., visualizing global data, creating an interactive world map, or building a web application]. It explores [Mention key topics/features of the project, e.g., data visualization techniques, interactive UI development, or geographic data handling]. The project aims to [Mention the project's goal, e.g., provide a user-friendly interface for exploring world data, showcase front-end development skills, or offer a solution for a specific problem].

title: resume
description: This repository hosts the source code for my resume, built primarily using TeX for professional formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for web-based viewing. It's a personal project showcasing my skills and experience in a presentable manner, and can be used as a template or inspiration for others creating their own resumes.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python (Flask framework), PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project demonstrates the creation of a web application capable of Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations on data stored within a PostgreSQL database, showcasing practical skills in backend development with Flask, frontend design, and database management, all while emphasizing a well-structured and maintainable Python project.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML and Python. This repository demonstrates how to create dynamic and informative maps for data representation and analysis, leveraging web technologies for user-friendly exploration. It serves as a practical example for learning about geographical data visualization and web-based mapping techniques.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API for engaging conversational experiences. This project showcases a modern tech stack including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to deliver a user-friendly interface for interacting with AI-powered dialogue. Explore the repository to see how these technologies are combined to create a dynamic and interactive conversational platform.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for efficiently visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, facilitating debugging and performance analysis in ROS-based applications. It leverages web technologies to offer a platform-independent solution for managing and understanding complex ROS log information.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, `finance-with-python`, contains a collection of Jupyter Notebook projects exploring various aspects of finance using Python. It leverages popular libraries like Pandas and NumPy to analyze financial data, perform calculations, and build models for tasks such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and potentially, more advanced financial modeling. This serves as a hands-on learning resource for anyone interested in applying Python to solve real-world finance problems.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI). This project demonstrates modern web development practices, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and management. It serves as a practical example for learning e-commerce development, incorporating type-safe code and covering key topics such as UI component implementation, data handling, and building a user-friendly online shopping experience.
